cnd7:2.1: "Sakyamuni! Alone..., the torrent": "Alone," Without a personal partner, or
cnd7:2.2: without my partner of the Dhamma: anyone who is dependent on the Dhamma can
cnd7:2.3: survive, can transcend, pass, surpass, and overcome the torrents of great
cnd7:2.4: desire, the torrents of seeing, the torrents of ignorance. "Sakyamuni,"
cnd7:2.5: Sakyamuni is a bhikkhu from the house of Sakya. This is Sakyamuni. Or, "the
cnd7:2.6: rich, the wealthy," this is also Sakyamuni. For him there are these wealth,
cnd7:2.7: namely: trusting wealth, abstaining from wealth, ashamed of wealth, hearing
cnd7:2.8: about wealth, giving wealth, wisdom wealth, mindfulness of wealth, righteous
cnd7:2.9: wealth, divine wealth, root wealth, strength wealth, enlightenment wealth, Path
cnd7:2.10: wealth, Fruit wealth, Nibbāna wealth, and use these various treasures as the
cnd7:2.11: rich, the wealthy. Or, those who are possible, those who are able, those who
cnd7:2.12: flow out all types of things, those who are sufficient, those who are heroes,
cnd7:2.13: those who are brave, those who are heroic, those who are not timid, those who
cnd7:2.14: are not frightened, those who do not run away, those who have given up fear of
cnd7:2.15: fear, those who have given up terror and fear. Doubts are called doubts: doubt
cnd7:2.16: of suffering, doubt of the path leading to suffering, doubt of the future, doubt
cnd7:2.17: of the past, doubt of the future and the past, doubt of causal connections, such
cnd7:2.18: doubts, suspicions, doubtful states, confusion, hesitation, crossroads,
cnd7:2.19: inconsistent grasping, hesitating, incomplete understanding, stiff state,
cnd7:3.1: "[Like this Venerable Upasīva]": "Like this," the continuation of the sentences,
cnd7:3.2: the connection of the words, the completion of the sentences, the combination of
cnd7:3.3: words, this is the order of the sentence, which is "like this." "Venerable,"
cnd7:3.4: this is a synonym of love, respect, and obedience. "Upasīva," the name, title,
cnd7:3.5: security of the Brāhmaṇa, title, word, phrase.
cnd7:4.1: "Unsupported, I can't get through": "Unsupported," without support of man or
cnd7:4.2: without support of the Dhamma, I can't get over it, transcend, pass, surpass,
cnd7:4.3: overcome the violent currents of great desire, the violent currents of seeing,
cnd7:5.1: "All-seeing, please tell about the object": The object, the dependence of the
cnd7:5.2: condition, the close dependence, please tell, please explain, teach, inform,
cnd7:5.3: establish, uncover, parse, clarify. "All-eyes," all eyes are called the state of
cnd7:5.4: all-knowing wisdom. Therefore, the Blessed One reaches (has), enters, enters
cnd7:5.5: completely, has sufficiently, the state of wisdom.
cnd7:6.1: "For him, there is nothing unseen here (in this world),
cnd7:6.2: There is no knowledge that cannot be known,
cnd7:6.3: He proves that everything that exists should be guided by inference,
cnd7:6.4: Because the Tathāgata, like that, is all-eyes."
cnd7:7.1: "Anyone who is dependent (on it) can ride through the torrent": "Anyone who is
cnd7:7.2: dependent," a mortal or Dhamma-based person can overcome, transcend, pass,
cnd7:7.3: surpass, and overcome the torrent of great desire, torrents of being, seeing

cnd7:9.3: Blessed One explained to him the dependence and the higher way out: enter into

cnd7:9.5: from there, seeing (it) is impermanent, suffering, and sick in the mind and

cnd7:10.1: "Those with mindfulness": all thoughts, perceptions, memories... (omitted), this

cnd7:11.1: "[The Blessed One: 'Upasīva!']": "Upasīva," the Blessed One calls the Brāhmaṇa
cnd7:11.2: by his surname. "The Blessed One" is synonymous with respect. In addition, the
cnd7:11.3: "greed breaker" is the Blessed One; the "sickness destroyer" is the Blessed One;
cnd7:11.4: "the one who has destroyed conceit" is the Blessed One; "the one who has
cnd7:11.5: destroyed the thorns" is the Blessed One; "the one who has destroyed the
cnd7:11.6: pollutants" is Blessed One; "the one who has ended" is the Blessed One; "the one
cnd7:11.7: who has practiced the body, the precepts, the mind, and the wisdom" is the
cnd7:11.8: Blessed One; or "the Blessed One is close to the woods, wild forests, and border
cnd7:11.9: dwellings (sitting place), where speaking is lessened, it is quiet, away from
cnd7:11.10: the human atmosphere, alone, and suitable for sitting alone" is the Blessed One;
cnd7:11.11: or "the Blessed One is the one who divides clothes, food, shelter, the needs of
cnd7:11.12: patients, and medical necessities"; or "the Blessed One is the one who has the
cnd7:11.13: taste of righteousness, the taste of Dhamma, the taste of liberation, the
cnd7:11.14: increased precepts, the mind, and the wisdom"; or "the Blessed One is the four
cnd7:11.15: types of jhāna, the four immeasurables, the four formlessness, etc., the one who
cnd7:11.16: divides is the Blessed One"; or the Blessed One is the one who has the eighth
cnd7:11.17: liberation, the eight victories, the ninth dwelling place, etc.; or the Blessed
cnd7:11.18: One is the practice of ten thoughts, (ten) abidings, the one who (observes) the
cnd7:11.19: in and out of breath; the one who is purely divided is the Blessed One; or the
cnd7:11.20: Blessed One divides the four mindfulness, the four righteousness, the four
cnd7:11.21: divine bases (iddhipāda), the five faculties, the five powers, the seven
cnd7:11.22: enlightenment factors, and the eight branches of the holy path; or the Blessed
cnd7:11.23: One is ten Tathāgata, four fearlessness, four unobstructed solutions, six
cnd7:11.24: supernatural powers and the six enlightenment methods. "Blessed One," this name
cnd7:11.25: is not given by the mother; not given by the father; not given by brothers; not
cnd7:11.26: given by sisters; not given by friends; not given by relatives; not given by
cnd7:11.27: Samaṇas or Brāhmaṇas; not given by heaven; it is ultimate liberation; the
cnd7:11.28: establishment (of the pseudonym) for the acquisition and testimony of the
cnd7:11.29: Buddha, the Blessed One, under the Bodhi tree, and all knowledge and wisdom,
cnd7:12.1: "Relying on 'nothing' makes you ride through the torrent": "Nothing" means
cnd7:12.2: dwelling in nothingness. For what reason is "nothing" dwelling in nothingness?
cnd7:12.3: Enter into the abode of boundless consciousness mindfully; after dwelling, come
cnd7:12.4: out from there; that consciousness, perceiving it to not exist, making it to
cnd7:12.5: disappear, he sees "nothing," and for this reason "nothing" is nothing. After
cnd7:12.6: relying on, and after doing what you want, you can get through, surpass, pass,
cnd7:12.7: go over, overcome the torrents of desire, torrents of being, the torrents of
cnd7:13.1: "After giving up on desire, have been freed from doubts": "Desire," there are
cnd7:13.2: two types of desires: the desire for things and the desire for pollution. What
cnd7:13.3: are the desires for things? Desirable sight, sound, smell, taste, touch;
cnd7:13.4: bedding, clothing, maidservants, goats and sheep, chickens and pigs, elephants,
cnd7:13.5: cows, horses, mules, horses, fields, houses, gold, gold coins, villages and
cnd7:13.6: towns, capitals, countries, territories, treasuries, warehouses; everything that
cnd7:13.7: can be tainted by greed is the desire for things.
cnd7:14.1: In addition, there are past desires, future desires, present desires, internal
cnd7:14.2: desires, external desires, internal and external desires, inferior desires,
cnd7:14.3: medium desires, superior desires; desires in the suffering world, human desires,
cnd7:14.4: heavenly desires, existing desire, created desire, uncreated desire, created
cnd7:14.5: desire by others, possessed desire, unpossessed desire, cherished desire,
cnd7:14.6: non-cherished desires; the desires of all the worlds of desire, the desires of
cnd7:14.7: all the worlds of physicality, all the desires of the world of non-material
cnd7:14.8: worlds, dependence on thirst and desire for love, desiring righteousness, greed
cnd7:14.9: for righteousness, the desire to be intoxicated by righteousness and happiness,
cnd7:14.10: is called the desire for things.
cnd7:15.1: What is the desire for defilement? The desire for desire, the desire for greed,

cnd7:15.3: desire for intention, the joy of desire, love obsession, the binding harness of
cnd7:15.4: desire, attachment, the desire for cover.
cnd7:16.2: Wanting to be produced by thought (intention),
cnd7:16.3: I will not think of them,
cnd7:17.1: These are called polluting desires. Craving thirst, attachment, it is greed,
cnd7:17.2: lust... (omitted) unwholesome roots. "Should give up on desire": In the desire
cnd7:17.3: to pollute, one should not be greedy, or obstructed in the desire of things,

cnd7:17.5: freed from greed, have renounced greed, have no greed, have eliminated greed,
cnd7:17.6: those who have attained the cessation of greed, have no hunger and thirst, those
cnd7:17.7: who have extinguished, have become cool, and feel joy, should live as a
cnd7:18.1: "After giving up on the desires," after knowing the desires for things, after

cnd7:18.8: beasts, abstinence, quashed, renunciation, and liberation, living with an
cnd7:19.1: "Day and night see the extinguishment of craving": The craving of "thirst"...

cnd7:19.4: extinction of greed, ...of hatred, ...of ignorance, of interest, of past life,

cnd7:21.1: "Anyone who has departed from greed in all desires": "In everything," all
cnd7:21.2: completely, completely in every aspect, without residue, and the whole earth.
cnd7:21.3: This is the language of pervasiveness, which is "in everything." "Desire,"
cnd7:21.4: ...(omitted). "Anyone who has departed from greed in all desires": Anyone who
cnd7:21.5: has gone away from greed in all desires, has no greed, has abandoned greed, has
cnd7:21.6: eliminated greed, has been freed from greed, has renounced greed, has broken
cnd7:21.7: greed, those who have suppressed greed.
cnd7:23.1: "Relying on non-owning and abandoning the others": The lower six attainments he
cnd7:23.2: abandons, renounces, after giving up forever, surpasses, crosses, overcomes, and
cnd7:23.3: attains the sphere of nothingness, non-dependent, non-clinging. Those who enter,
cnd7:23.4: those who fully enter, those who are tied, those who turn their minds toward
cnd7:24.1: "The victors who are liberated at the highest level": Those who are liberated
cnd7:24.2: are called the seven attainments, and the liberation of nothingness is the
cnd7:24.3: first, the most victorious, the best, the foremost, the highest, the top, the
cnd7:24.4: winner of liberation, the overcomer, the character, the abundant, the serious,
cnd7:24.5: the one with that as the object, inclining to, leading to, resolved, the winner.
cnd7:25.1: "Can he dwell there and become a non-traveler": "Can he dwell," questioning of
cnd7:25.2: doubt, questioning of perplexity, questioning of confusion, more than one
cnd7:25.3: question: "Is that so? Isn't that true? What is it? How is it?" "There," in
cnd7:25.4: nowhere. "Non-travelers," those who do not follow, those who do not shake
cnd7:25.5: (waver), those who do not leave, those who do not disappear, and those who do
cnd7:25.6: not return. Or, the one who is not infected, the one who does not fall, the one
cnd7:25.7: who does not change to be foolish, the one who is not defiled.

cnd7:35.1: "Will he become cooled and liberated? Will the consciousness of a person like
cnd7:35.2: that die?": The arrival of the cool state, constant, firm, eternal, and
cnd7:35.3: unchanging. Will it survive as everlasting? Or will his consciousness die, be
cnd7:35.4: extinguished, disappear, perish, or not exist? Will some reborn consciousness be
cnd7:35.5: born from the desire realm, or the physical realm, or the non-material realm? He
cnd7:35.6: asked of the permanence and extinction of those who have entered into
cnd7:35.7: nothingness. Or will they there realize Nibbāna in the ultimate unremaining
cnd7:35.8: Nibbāna? Or, will his consciousness die, and the further realization of
cnd7:35.9: consciousness will arise in the desire realm, Or the physical realm, or the
cnd7:35.10: non-material realm? He asked about the Nibbāna and consummation of those who
cnd7:35.11: have no place to regenerate. "That type of person," Like that, the fixator, this
cnd7:35.12: type, the similar, the rebirth after nothingness.

cnd7:37.1: "Like a flame thrown by the wind": The flame is called a light flame. "Wind,"
cnd7:37.2: east wind, west wind, north wind, south wind, dusty wind, dust-free wind, cold
cnd7:37.3: wind, hot wind, small wind, extreme wind, swift wind, cross wind, wind of the
cnd7:37.4: golden-winged bird, wind of the dormitory leaves, wind of the fan. "Tossed by

cnd7:39.1: "Goes to extinction, cannot be reckoned": "Walk to extinction," to go to
cnd7:39.2: extinction, make it go to extinction, be extinct, be calmed down, to stop.
cnd7:39.3: "Cannot be reckoned by name," is difficult to be given a name, saying does not
cnd7:39.4: come, counting does not come, designating does not come: "It has arrived in the
cnd7:39.5: east, or has arrived in the west, or has arrived in the north, or has arrived in
cnd7:39.6: the south, or has reached the top, or has reached the bottom, or has reached the
cnd7:39.7: horizontal direction, or has reached the middle of the four directions." It has
cnd7:39.8: no cause, no predestiny, and no factor that will fall into (walk to) the name.
cnd7:40.1: "Muni is free from name and body like this": "Like this" is a figurative
cnd7:40.2: arrangement. "Muni," Muni is called wisdom, understanding, simple selection,
cnd7:40.3: investigation, discernment, recognition, discrimination, close observation,
cnd7:40.4: inspection, learned virtuous wisdom, proficiency, cleverness, study, reflection,
cnd7:40.5: review, contemplation, examination, general comprehensive wisdom, vipassanā,
cnd7:40.6: right knowledge, stabbing rod, wisdom root, wisdom sword, wisdom palace, wisdom
cnd7:40.7: brightness, wisdom light, no delusion, choice of dhamma, right view. The Blessed
cnd7:40.8: One has the wisdom of Muni, reaching Muni. There are three Muni (perfect
cnd7:40.9: virtues): body Muni, language Muni, intention Muni.
cnd7:41.1: What is the body of Muni? The three types of body and evil deeds are cut off as
cnd7:41.2: the Muni position; the three types of good behaviors are the Muni position; the

cnd7:41.5: abandonment of desire and greed, cut off, as the Muni; the fourth jhāna
cnd7:41.6: extinction of the body is the position of Muni.

cnd7:43.1: What is intention Muni? The three types of deeds of intention and evil deeds are
cnd7:43.2: the Muni position; the three types of good deeds are the Muni position; the
cnd7:43.3: wisdom in the mind-object is the Muni position; the knowledge of the heart is
cnd7:43.4: the Muni position; the one that walks the Path with knowledge is the position of
cnd7:43.5: Muni; the desire and greed of the heart being judged is the position of Muni;
cnd7:43.6: the desire to perish the mind is the position of Muni.
cnd7:44.1: "Body Muni, Language Muni, and Intention Muni are no troubles,
cnd7:44.2: Muni has the status of Muni, and they say he is the one who cuts everything.
cnd7:44.3: Body Muni, Language Muni, and Intention Muni are no troubles,
cnd7:44.4: Muni has the status of Muni, and they say that they are those who have been cleansed of evil."
cnd7:45.1: The six types of Muni have these three modes of Muni: Muni at home, Muni without
cnd7:45.2: a home, Muni with learning, Muni without learning, Bhikkhu Muni, Muni (of the)
cnd7:45.3: Muni. Which is at home? Those laymen who have seen the footsteps and have
cnd7:45.4: learned the precepts, these are at home. Which are homeless Muni? Those bhikkhus
cnd7:45.5: who have seen the footsteps and who have learned the precepts are homeless Muni.
cnd7:45.6: There are seven types of learning for learning Muni, Arahant for non-learning
cnd7:45.7: Muni, and Bhikkhu Buddha as Bhikkhu Muni. Muni (of) Muni is called Tathāgata,
cnd7:46.1: "Non-wise is Muni, a foolish and ignorant man,
cnd7:46.2: After raising the scale, take the top one and become a wise man.
cnd7:46.3: Avoid all evils, that Muni became Muni because of that,
cnd7:46.4: Everyone who understands the (inner and outer sum) in the world,
cnd7:46.5: Because that is said to be Muni.
cnd7:46.6: Who knows all the inside and outside of the world,
cnd7:46.7: The unwholesome and the good behind the Dhamma,
cnd7:46.8: Everyone who is supported (respected) by heaven and man,
cnd7:46.9: Beyond staining and the net, he is Muni."
cnd7:47.1: "Already freed from the name and body," the Muni who had been freed from the
cnd7:47.2: body before, crossed that portion, cut off. For the Muni, because of the
cnd7:47.3: existence, the four holy ways are obtained, the name and body are known in the
cnd7:47.4: attained four holy ways, and knowing the name and form, there is disengagement,
cnd7:48.1: "Walking to extinction, he cannot be reckoned": "He doesn't come to the name"
cnd7:48.2: with the world of Nibbāna without remnants. "He does not come to the name," he
cnd7:48.3: does not come to the name of the one who realizes Nibbāna in the world of
cnd7:48.4: Nibbāna without residue. He does not come (he is difficult to be given a name),
cnd7:48.5: in saying he does not come, in counting he does not come, and designating he
cnd7:48.6: does not come: "khattiya," or "Brāhmaṇa," or "vessa," or "sudda," or "at home,"
cnd7:48.7: or "uncle," or "god," or "person," or "form," or "formless," or "thinking," or
cnd7:48.8: "not thinking," or "neither thinking nor not-thinking;" he has no cause, no
cnd7:48.9: predestiny, and no factor to fall into (walk to) the name.
cnd7:49.1: <em>44 : (Upasīva:) Has he reached extinction, or he does not exist,
cnd7:49.2: Or is he a disease-free person?
cnd7:49.3: I ask Muni to explain this thoroughly for me,
cnd7:49.4: Because like this you are the knower of this Dhamma.
cnd7:49.5: <em>44 : (Upasīva:) Has he reached extinction, or he does not exist,
cnd7:49.6: Or is he a disease-free person?
cnd7:49.7: I ask Muni to explain this thoroughly for me,
cnd7:49.8: Because like this you are the knower of this Dhamma.
cnd7:49.9: <em>44 : (Upasīva:) Has he reached extinction, or he does not exist,
cnd7:49.10: Or is he a disease-free person?
cnd7:49.11: I ask Muni to explain this thoroughly for me,
cnd7:49.12: Because like this you are the knower of this Dhamma.
cnd7:49.13: <em>44 : (Upasīva:) Has he reached extinction, or he does not exist,
cnd7:49.14: Or is he a disease-free person?
cnd7:49.15: I ask Muni to explain this thoroughly for me,
cnd7:49.16: Because like this you are the knower of this Dhamma.
cnd7:50.1: "Has he reached extinction or he does not exist": He has reached extinction or
cnd7:50.2: does not exist, he has been annihilated, has been destroyed, has been
cnd7:51.1: "Eternally disease-free": It is still constant, firm, eternal, and unchanging.
cnd7:52.1: "Muni, please explain this thoroughly for me": "That," ...(omitted). "Muni,"
cnd7:53.1: "Because you are the knower of these Dhammas like this": Because you are the
cnd7:53.2: knower of these Dhammas like this, the measurer, the judge, the clarifier.
cnd7:54.2: For the one who has reach extinction, there is no measure,
cnd7:54.3: Nothing can be said of his existence,
cnd7:54.4: When all dhamma has been eradicated,
cnd7:54.5: All language paths are also eradicated.
cnd7:54.7: For the one who has reach extinction, there is no measure,
cnd7:54.8: Nothing can be said of his existence,
cnd7:54.9: When all dhamma has been eradicated,
cnd7:54.10: All language paths are also eradicated.
cnd7:54.12: For the one who has reach extinction, there is no measure,
cnd7:54.13: Nothing can be said of his existence,
cnd7:54.14: When all dhamma has been eradicated,
cnd7:54.15: All language paths are also eradicated.
cnd7:54.17: For the one who has reach extinction, there is no measure,
cnd7:54.18: Nothing can be said of his existence,
cnd7:54.19: When all dhamma has been eradicated,
cnd7:54.20: All language paths are also eradicated.
cnd7:54.22: For the one who has reach extinction, there is no measure,
cnd7:54.23: Nothing can be said of his existence,
cnd7:54.24: When all dhamma has been eradicated,
cnd7:54.25: All language paths are also eradicated.
cnd7:55.1: "For those who have reached extinction, there is no measure": For those who have
cnd7:55.2: reached extinction, for those who have no remnants of Nibbāna, the measure of
cnd7:55.3: form does not exist, the measure of receiving does not exist, ...thinking does
cnd7:55.4: not exist, ...action..., ...consciousness..., it does not exist is not known, is
cnd7:55.5: not discovered, has been cut off, calmed down, stopped, unable to arise, and
cnd7:55.6: burned by the fire of wisdom.
cnd7:57.1: "What can be said about him does not exist for him": What can be said about him
cnd7:57.2: in terms of greed; ...what type of hatred; ...foolishness; ...sloth; in view,
cnd7:57.3: who can speak of him; what can be said about him by what disbelief; ...by what
cnd7:57.4: suspicion; ...by the latent tendency of troubles, become "infected," or
cnd7:57.5: "disgusting," or "ignorant," or "being bound," or "clinging," or "coming to
cnd7:57.6: disorganization," or "coming to dissatisfaction," or "coming to fortitude?"
cnd7:57.7: Those deeds have been abandoned. What state of interest has been abandoned, he
cnd7:57.8: will tremble and become a "hell-fallen," or a "beast-fallen person," or a
cnd7:57.9: "hungry ghost land person," or a "human," or a "heaven," or a "formed," or
cnd7:57.11: non-thinking?" He has no cause, no predestination, no factor to say so, to tell,
cnd7:58.1: "When all dhammas have been eradicated": In all dhammas, in all aggregates, in
cnd7:58.2: all places, in all realms, in all places of interest, in all rebirth, in all
cnd7:58.3: incarnations, in all existence, in all reincarnation, when the cycle has been
cnd7:58.4: pulled out, when it has been eradicated, when it has been removed, when it has
cnd7:58.5: been completely removed, when it has been disconnected, when it has calmed down,
cnd7:58.6: when it has ceased, when it cannot arise, when it has been burned by the fire of
cnd7:59.1: "All language paths are also eradicated": The language path is called the
cnd7:59.2: pollution and the various aggregates and the various creations. For him, the
cnd7:59.3: language, the language path, the name (increase of words), the language, and the
cnd7:59.4: peace, has been pulled out, has been eradicated, ...(omitted).
cnd7:60.1: At the end of these verses... "The Blessed One is my teacher, I am a disciple."
